alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 25 at 5:11PM EST until December 26 at 8:23AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Mississinewa River near Ridgeville affecting Delaware and Randolph Counties. .Recent rainfall has led to a rise on the Mississinewa River near Ridgeville that will see a crest above flood stage tonight before falling back below flood stage tomorrow morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Mississinewa River banks about one mile east of Ridgeville and in other areas begin to overflow at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 10.4 feet and then begin rising this evening. It will then rise again to 10.5 feet late this evening. It will fall to 10.3 feet and then begin rising late this evening. It will then rise again to 10.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 515 AM EST.
